title: Mother banned from flying Ryanair after ‘assaulting’ staff member
text:
Adedoyin Abiodun denies all allegations of assault and says her family are ‘victims’ (Picture: Shutterstock / Rebius)

A mother-of-two has been banned from flying with Ryanair for life after she was accused of assaulting a member of staff.

Adedoyin Abiodun was flying to Bordeaux with her family to celebrate her cousin’s birthday when an issue over priority boarding spurred a heated confrontation in which police were called.

The mother-of-two missed her family holiday and can never fly with Ryanair again.

However, she denies allegations of assault, claiming staff were a ‘mad mob of hooligans’ who treated her ‘like a criminal’ for no reason.

On Friday 23 August, Mrs Abiodun and her husband realised they had overpacked for their bank holiday away and went to the Ryanair website to book priority so they could take extra suitcases.

The couple claim the website crashed and wasn’t showing them to be priority customers, but they assumed it had worked because Ryanair had taken the money for priority boarding.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Along with their daughter, son and son’s girlfriend, they rushed to Stansted Airport to catch their flight to France.

But when they got to the front of the priority queue, they were told by a Ryanair staff member that they had only booked priority for their return flight and were sent to the back of the non-priority customer queue.

The email sent to Adedoyin Abiodun from Ryanair stated she was ‘hereby prohibited from flying with Ryanair again’ (Picture: Adedoyin Abiodun)

The email initially included an incorrect date (Picture: Adedoyin Abiodun)

There, they were approached by a female Ryanair staff member who ‘aggressively’ told them they had to put their bags in the hold as they weren’t priority.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk, Mrs Abiodun, who works as an independent travel agent, says the family were made to feel like they’d ‘committed a crime from the off’.

She said: ‘She was so abrupt, so unprofessional. So just so horrible, right from the the off.

‘She was just so unfriendly. I’ve never seen anything like it in my life.

‘She was kind of being aggressive to all of us but in particular to me.

‘I just felt she was directing some kind of anger or hatred towards me, right from the off.

‘I don’t even know her. I don’t know what I’ve come to, to upset her so much. So, yeah, it didn’t fit.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

When Mrs Abiodun’s husband asked if they were required to pay extra money to store their bags in the hold, the Ryanair worker confirmed this was the case.

Mrs Abiodun says her family were made to feel like they’d ‘committed a crime from the off’ (Picture: Shutterstock / Rebius)

Mrs Abiodun’s husband got out his card to pay, but told her that ‘if she needed extra money, this wasn’t the way to go about it’.

The staff member allegedly then began ‘shouting and screaming that he was getting in her personal space and that she was doing her job’.

The family deny he had entered her personal space.

But following a tense exchange of words, the staff member allegedly became upset and broke down in tears.

Mrs Abiodun says it was at this point that the Ryanair worker accused her of ‘slapping’ her.

She has denied all accusations of assault, saying: ‘I said, how would I? I haven’t touched her. How did I slap her?

‘We haven’t made physical contact.There was no slap whatsoever.’

After the accusation was allegedly made, the travel agent claims a group of Ryanair workers crowded around them and all confirmed they had seen the slap take place.

The incident happened at Stansted Airport in London (Picture: NurPhoto/PA Images)

Mrs Abiodun says one staff member made ‘rude faces’ at her, but was reprimanded by another who told him he couldn’t behave that way in front of a customer.

Advertisement

The mother-of-two was forced to miss her flight when the police were called.

She was not arrested, but her husband, who had booked the trip, later received an email stating that she was banned for life from all Ryanair flights.

She couldn’t afford another flight and spent the bank holiday weekend by herself at home while her family celebrated her cousin’s 60th birthday in France.

Mrs Abiodun says her family are ‘victims’ in the situation and has slammed Ryanair for ‘lying’ and treating her ‘with no respect’.

She said: ‘I am amazed that they really expected me to come back and book with them after they way they’ve treated me and my family and completely ruined our family holiday.

‘I am completely overcome with grief every time our family holiday is mentioned.’

Carers blew Parkinson's patient's life savings on make-up and new clothes

Speaking about the incident Ryanair spokesperson said: ‘The gate agents of this flight from London Stansted to Bordeaux (23 August) requested police assistance during boarding after a passenger became disruptive.

‘The safety and comfort of our customers, crew and aircraft is our number one priority.

‘This passenger has been banned from flying with Ryanair again and this is now a matter for local police.’

A spokeswoman from Essex Police said: ‘We were called around 4.30pm on Friday 23 August with reports of an altercation at the Passenger Terminal of Stansted Airport.

‘It was reported that a passenger had verbally abused and assaulted a member of staff by pushing them, causing no injury.

Advertisement

‘Officers arrived and a community resolution was agreed.

‘The passenger was spoken to and removed from the airport.

‘No arrests were made.’

description: A woman has allegedly been banned from flying with Ryanair for life after a heated incident at Stansted Airport on Bank Holiday Friday.
